segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely oblivious to the water overflowing all around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she just keeps polishing that plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water spilling over the counter, streaming down the cabinets, and pooling on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet is still running, and the sink is completely full, but she doesn’t even glance at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be lost in thought or maybe just exhausted to miss something so obvious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she hasn’t noticed them either.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll realize what’s happening before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between her calmness and the chaos around her is almost comical.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t slipped yet with all that water on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet before it gets worse.
segments.speaker: PAR
